definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: Xia defends a city the official berates the sound to awaken me.
sentences.chinese: 夏总兵的喝斥声将我唤醒。

sentences.english: B.He shouted to the old man.
LiYuan to spot he rebuked the son.
sentences.chinese: 李渊一听当场喝斥儿子。

sentences.english: During the father he rebuked the instead have smiles.
sentences.chinese: 李世民被父亲喝斥反而面露微笑。

sentences.english: A. She shouted at the old man.
Patrasche was always yelled at and was often hit with a stick.
sentences.chinese: 帕特拉斯基经常遭到喝斥和棍子的鞭打。

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to shout at sb to stop
to shout an order or command
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
